publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3928<> Maureen Macmillan: 21st Anniversary of the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation—That the Parliament recognises the importance to Scotland of wild salmon conservation; further recognises the vital work undertaken by the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation (NASCO), the only international treaty organisation based in Scotland, and welcomes the 21st anniversary of the establishment of NASCO.
S2M-3928<> 21st Anniversary of the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation (lodged on 7 February 2006) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3928<> Maureen Macmillan: 21st Anniversary of the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation—That the Parliament recognises the importance to Scotland of wild salmon conservation; further recognises the vital work undertaken by the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation (NASCO), the only international treaty organisation based in Scotland, and welcomes the 21st anniversary of the establishment of NASCO. Supported by: Donald Gorrie
S2M-3928<> 21st Anniversary of the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation (lodged on 7 February 2006) Sarah Boyack*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-3928<> 21st Anniversary of the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation (lodged on 7 February 2006) Jackie Baillie*, Richard Lochhead*, Trish Godman*
S2M-3928# 21st Anniversary of the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation (lodged on 7 February 2006) Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-3928# 21st Anniversary of the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation (lodged on 7 February 2006) Eleanor Scott*

S2M-3928# Maureen Macmillan: 21st Anniversary of the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation—That the Parliament recognises the importance to Scotland of wild salmon conservation; further recognises the vital work undertaken by the North Atlantic Salmon Conservation Organisation (NASCO), the only international treaty organisation based in Scotland, and welcomes the 21st anniversary of the establishment of NASCO. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Sarah Boyack, Nora Radcliffe, Jackie Baillie, Richard Lochhead, Trish Godman, Robin Harper, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Marilyn Livingstone, Eleanor Scott Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
